title: Unclear regression in DLNA server with LG WebOS TV in rclone version 1.59
body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put into solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I am using rclone as a DLNA server for my LG TV, and since rclone version 1.59 the TV only reports "No files exist".

I bisected this down to 59c242bbf6c3dac3cff848691f84f58bd69a29cf i.e. this is the first commit that results in this error. Sadly this is a dependency update commit which makes it a lot harder to judge what change caused this.
VLC still finds the files via the server, so this is some weird interaction between something that changed in this commit and how LG WebOS expects a DLNA server to behave. I don't see a dependency that contains `DLNA` in the name, but if someone tells me likely candidates that could have caused this I can check those too, and then open an issue with that project if applicable.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

This is with the release from Github
```
$ rclone-v1.59.0-linux-amd64/rclone version
rclone v1.59.0
- os/version: arch "rolling" (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.18.14-arch1-1 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.18.3
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

arch "rolling" (64 bit)

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

none

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone serve dlna /storage_ssd/video/`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2022/08/01 22:04:02 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.60.0-beta.6376.3a8e52de7" starting with parameters ["rclone-v1.60.0-beta.6376.3a8e52de7-linux-amd64/rclone" "serve" "dlna" "--addr" ":7880" "--name" "monolith" "/storage_ssd/video/" "-vvv"]
2022/08/01 22:04:02 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "/storage_ssd/video/"
2022/08/01 22:04:02 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/fmagin/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2022/08/01 22:04:02 INFO  : Local file system at /storage_ssd/video/: poll-interval is not supported by this remote
2022/08/01 22:04:02 NOTICE: Local file system at /storage_ssd/video/: Serving HTTP on [::]:7880
2022/08/01 22:04:02 INFO  : DLNA server on :7880: Started SSDP on virbr2
2022/08/01 22:04:02 INFO  : DLNA server on :7880: Started SSDP on virbr1
2022/08/01 22:04:02 INFO  : DLNA server on :7880: Started SSDP on enp34s0
2022/08/01 22:04:02 INFO  : DLNA server on :7880: Started SSDP on virbr0
2022/08/01 22:04:03 INFO  : /static/ContentDirectory.xml: 192.168.178.39:60636 GET 200  
2022/08/01 22:04:03 INFO  : /static/ContentDirectory.xml: 192.168.178.39:60634 GET 200  
2022/08/01 22:04:03 INFO  : /static/ConnectionManager.xml: 192.168.178.39:60634 GET 200  
2022/08/01 22:04:03 INFO  : /static/ConnectionManager.xml: 192.168.178.39:60636 GET 200  
2022/08/01 22:04:03 INFO  : /static/X_MS_MediaReceiverRegistrar.xml: 192.168.178.39:60634 GET 200  
2022/08/01 22:04:03 INFO  : /static/X_MS_MediaReceiverRegistrar.xml: 192.168.178.39:60636 GET 200  
2022/08/01 22:04:03 ERROR : /: 192.168.178.39:60634 SUBSCRIBE 404  
2022/08/01 22:04:03 ERROR : /: 192.168.178.39:60636 SUBSCRIBE 404  
2022/08/01 22:04:03 ERROR : /: 192.168.178.39:60638 SUBSCRIBE 404  
2022/08/01 22:04:03 ERROR : /: 192.168.178.39:60640 SUBSCRIBE 404  
2022/08/01 22:04:03 INFO  : /ctl: 192.168.178.39:60642 POST 200 "urn:schemas-upnp-org:service:ContentDirectory:1#GetSearchCapabilities" 
2022/08/01 22:04:04 INFO  : /ctl: 192.168.178.39:60642 POST 200 "urn:schemas-upnp-org:service:ContentDirectory:1#Browse" 
2022/08/01 22:04:37 INFO  : /ctl: 192.168.178.39:60642 POST 200 "urn:schemas-upnp-org:service:ContentDirectory:1#Browse" 
```
It looks the same with a working version, i.e. those `SUBSCRIBE 404  ` errors also show up when it's working.
